snippet: Buenos Aires now provides pensions to about 80 writers, and as other countries trim social programs, Argentina is considering expanding the literary benefit nationwide.
abstract: Buenos Aires Journal; Buenos Aires offers yet another reason for writers to live within its borders--pensions; city now gives a monthly stipend to published writers, in a program attempting to bolster one of the strongest literary traditions in the Spanish-speaking world; more than 80 writers have been offered the pensions, which can reach almost $900 a month.
lead_paragraph: Buenos Aires now provides pensions to about 80 writers, and as other countries trim social programs, Argentina is considering expanding the literary benefit nationwide.

headline.seo: Argentina Offers Its Aging Writers a Little Security
headline.main: Argentina’s New Literary Tradition: Pensions for Aging Writers
headline.print_headline: Argentina’s New Literary Tradition: Pensions for Aging Writers
